result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Berth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David J Berth is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David J Berth was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • David J Berth was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: All conditions of Count 1 are inclusive of Count 3.

Def in person & by Atty Julie A. Maule.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State moves to amend complaint to add Count 3 of DC-947.01(1) and moves to dismiss Count 2 outright, State makes statements on dismissal.  Court grants dismissal of Count 2 and amendment to adding Count 3.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1 and Count 3 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1 and Count 3 as amended and enters judgment.
